ygData.subject: Re: Lynxiz / New poll for nbwrpg
ygData.msgSnippet: This is getting quite redundant Dewboy... I asked you not to post anything about the Rocak ship... and I asked you to post this stuff on the message board.

This is getting quite redundant Dewboy... I asked you not to post 
anything about the Rocak ship... and I asked you to post this stuff 
on the message board. 

Which poll are you talking about, the one that is currently up? Or 
the first one regarding rights of deletion and alteration?

Ok, you want to know why nobody is standing up for you? or why 
nobody likes you? (with the exception of Cyberwolf I guess) Well... 
I think one of the biggest reasons is that you can't, CAN'T, 
understand instructions, it just doesn't seem possible. I asked you 
to hold the posting with the Rocak, but nope, you posted. I asked 
you to refrain from posting with OOC messages, and that there is a 
message board at the site, but nope, you just keep posting with 
OOC's. I asked you a simple question about your email address a 
while ago, and you insulted me. Do you really want to make 
friends? Cause right now, you're making enemies...


On 30 Jul 2001, at 23:11, dewboy30816@... wrote:

>  HE DID ALTER MY POLL ABOUT WHETHER OR NOT HE HAS A RIGHT TO DELETE
> OTHER PEAOPLES POLLS! I DID NOT ADD IN THAT PART ABOUT IF THEY ARE
> OFFENSIVE TO ANYONE! HE SHOULD HAVE SIMPLE DELETED IT(proving my point
> in the process ironically)!
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "rAuq" <rauq@t...> wrote:
> > ooC message after IC text. Dewboy read it, please.
> > 
> > --- Lynxiz / Lokk / Axis ---
> > 
> > Axis brightens as he spies Windlord. "There he is, right over 
> there. 
> > See?" Having helped Lynxiz, Axis turns to talk to Seekker, 
> > snorting in disagreement with his assessment of the battle. "Bah,
> > you did almost nothing, and when you acctually did that something,
> > it hurt US more than THEM. Hehe," Axis laughs once, then shakes his
> > head.
> > 
> > Lynxiz smiles as she spots Windlord as well. Nodding to Axis, the
> > thanks him, and proceeds to make her way between missile craters and
> > other obstacles on the battle charred ground in front 
> of 
> > the Chivitron base. Heading towards Windlord, she waves to try to
> > get his attention.
> > 
> > Lokk stops and turns slightly to regard Grounded, his face grimly
> > showing agreement. "Yeah... that will be ugly... ugly be necessary."
> > He keeps heading back to the base, his path taking him towards
> > Windlord.
> > 
> > 
> > OOC: Dewboy, your poll (the one below) needs to be altered. First
> > off, Zardus doesn't alter or delete biased polls that aren't 
> offensive. 
> > Secondly, he doesn't alter, and hasn't altered, biased polls so 
> they 
> > represent the opposite bias (though i believe that it depends on
> > who's point of view you are coming from.). If the poll isn't 
> offensive, 
> > then Zardus most likely won't delete it. 
> > 
> > Next thing. Did you read all of my post entitled "Dewboy" (post #
> > 41061)? If so, I will ask you again, did you read all of my post
> > entitled "Dewboy" (post # 41061)? If you still answer Yes, then I
> > will ask you for the last time, did you read all of my post 
> entitled 
> > "Dewboy" (post # 41061)? Since you posted for your characters 
> > finding the Rocak ship, the answer to my question is obviously no.
> > Now you're going to have to hold (this time, don't actually post)
> > your posts regarding the Rocak ship. Then you must send the council
> > a detailed list of weapons, capabilities, size and 
> capacity. 
> > Ok? =)
> > 
> > Last thing... Ok, I'm done for now, until I think of something else 
> to 
> > say. =P
> > 
> > On 30 Jul 2001, at 11:19, nbwrpg@y... wrote:
> > 
> > > 
> > > Enter your vote today!  A new poll has been created for the 
> > > nbwrpg group:
> > > 
> > > Does Zardus have a right to alter 
> > > biased polls so they represent the 
> > > opposite bias or should he just delete 
> > > them like offensive polls? 
> > > 
> > >   o alter 
> > >   o delete 
> > > 
> > >
